intro: Geonoma deversa subsp. quadriflora, commonly known as the four-flowered geonoma, is a species of flowering plant in the family Cyclanthaceae. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil and Peru. The plant is characterized by its erect, herbaceous stems and large, palmately lobed leaves. Its inflorescence consists of a dense cluster of small, white to pale green flowers. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical rainforests.
